attributes.action: Pay carers who look after someone at home the same as working NHS carers
attributes.additional_details: Many people who care for a loved one at home, will do so unconditionally, but at the same time they are struggling financially as they are unable to work.  In many cases, not even on a part-time basis.  This is unacceptable and they should be rewarded for their commitment and not struggle to pay the bills just because a loved one needs round-the-clock care.
attributes.background: People who care for a family relative at their home on a full-time basis, receive £69.70 per week (approximately £3600 per year).  A community carer can earn upwards of £20,000 per year (before tax).  At home carers should be paid the same as they are unable to work due to their commitments at home.
